images.copyright: Reindeer during winter snowfall, Lapland, Finland (© Roberto Moiola/Getty Images)
images.title: Info
images.caption: Reindeer, Lapland, Finland
images.desc: Few creatures evoke the magic of the holidays quite like the reindeer. Also known as caribou, they are the spirit animals of Christmas lovers—and they rock it. Sturdy and sure-footed, they've been pulling Santa's sleigh ever since Clement Clarke Moore cast them in the role in his 1823 poem 'A Visit from Saint Nicholas.' And they were born for it. Their hooves shrink in winter to expose a gripping rim, then expand in warmer months for better traction.

og.title: Reindeer, Lapland, Finland
og.desc: Few creatures evoke the magic of the holidays quite like the reindeer. Also known as caribou, they are the spirit animals of Christmas…

images.copyright: Starling murmuration over the ruins of Brighton's West Pier, England (© Philip Reeve/Photodisc/Getty Images)
images.title: Info
images.caption: Starling murmuration, Brighton, England
images.desc: When a bird is called a starling, you'd expect it to be a bit of a show-off. True to its name, this little creature knows how to steal the spotlight. From shimmering feathers that glint green and purple in the sun, to its ability to mimic sounds, the starling is the headline act. Originally native to Europe and Asia, the common starling has spread across the globe. In the 19th century, a group of them were introduced to New York's Central Park by an enthusiast of birds mentioned in Shakespeare's plays.

og.title: Starling murmuration, Brighton, England
og.desc: When a bird is called a starling, you'd expect it to be a bit of a show-off. True to its name, this little creature knows how to steal the…

images.copyright: Lagazzuolo Lake, Valmalenco, Lombardy, Italy (© Francesco Bergamaschi/Getty Images)
images.title: Info
images.caption: Lagazzuolo Lake, Valmalenco, Lombardy, Italy
images.desc: In the heart of Valmalenco, Lombardy, Italy, at nearly 2,000 metres above sea level, Lake Lagazzuolo reveals itself like a secret hidden within the mountains' folds. The 2.5-kilometre trek leading there weaves through woods and stone, inviting you to slow down with each step. The hike ranges from moderate to challenging, with an elevation gain of around 590 metres, making it perfect for those seeking a fun outdoor experience.

og.title: Lagazzuolo Lake, Valmalenco, Lombardy, Italy
og.desc: In the heart of Valmalenco, Lombardy, Italy, at nearly 2,000 metres above sea level, Lake Lagazzuolo reveals itself like a secret hidden…

images.copyright: Alte Brücke Bridge, Frankfurt, Germany (© diegograndi/Getty Images)
images.title: Info
images.caption: Alte Brücke Bridge, Frankfurt, Germany
images.desc: Frankfurt, the vibrant metropolis in the heart of Germany, captivates visitors with its unique blend of modern skyline and historic old town. A prominent landmark is the Alte Brücke—known in German as 'Old Bridge'—which has spanned the Main River since the Middle Ages and is considered one of the city's oldest river crossings. For centuries, it served as an important trade route. The bridge is particularly charming at sunset.

og.title: Alte Brücke Bridge, Frankfurt, Germany
og.desc: Frankfurt, the vibrant metropolis in the heart of Germany, captivates visitors with its unique blend of modern skyline and historic old town…

images.copyright: Dawn light through frosty trees, Sweden (© Schon/Getty Images)
images.title: Info
images.caption: Dawn light through frosty trees, Sweden
images.desc: Ever wondered why some days feel endless while others pass in the blink of an eye? This fascinating rhythm of day and night is closely tied to a remarkable event called the solstice. Occurring twice a year, solstices mark the moments when the Sun reaches its highest or lowest point in the sky at noon, resulting the longest and shortest days of the year. There are two solstices each year: the summer solstice and the winter solstice.

og.title: Dawn light through frosty trees, Sweden
og.desc: Ever wondered why some days feel endless while others pass in the blink of an eye? This fascinating rhythm of day and night is closely tied…

images.title: Info
images.caption: Red fox
images.desc: Some animals rely on strength, others on speed. Foxes? They rely on brains. And the red fox, seen in today's image, has mastered the art. Found across nearly every type of landscape on Earth, foxes have adapted over time to deserts, forests and suburbs alike. The red fox's story began in Eurasia about 400,000 years ago and around 130,000 years ago, these creatures crossed into North America and found a permanent home.

og.title: Red fox
og.desc: Some animals rely on strength, others on speed. Foxes? They rely on brains. And the red fox, seen in today's image, has mastered the art…

images.copyright: Snow-covered landscape at Bormio, Lombardy, Italy (© Roberto Moiola/Getty Images)
images.title: Info
images.caption: Bormio, Lombardy, Italy
images.desc: Bormio is a mountain town in northern Italy's Lombardy region, nestled in the Alps near the Stelvio Pass. This location has connected communities across mountain valleys for centuries, shaping how people live and move through the region. Today's image features Bormio's winter landscape, a reflection of its high-altitude setting and enduring bond with the surrounding peaks.

og.title: Bormio, Lombardy, Italy
og.desc: Bormio is a mountain town in northern Italy's Lombardy region, nestled in the Alps near the Stelvio Pass. This location has connected…

images.copyright: Temple of the Sun, Capitol Reef National Park, Utah, United States (© Austin Cronnelly/TANDEM Stills + Motion)
images.title: Info
images.caption: Temple of the Sun, Capitol Reef National Park, Utah, United States
images.desc: Rock layers formed over millions of years and a massive bend in the Earth's crust give this desert a rare window into geologic history. This is Capitol Reef National Park in Utah, where sandstone cliffs and canyons preserve a striking record of the planet's past. It was designated as a national park in 1971. Today's featured image highlights the sandstone monoliths of Cathedral Valley, including the Temple of the Sun, part of this extraordinary, protected landscape.
